result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian F Guimar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. (fine and costs have been paid in full)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian F Guimar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brian F Guimar
Current: 438 N. 6th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 02-12-2016)
Prior: 8099 Stewart Ln, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

DCCC Stipulated Pretrial Disposition - Defendant has complied with the State's pretrial offer, State moves to amend Ct. 1 to a county ordinance of Battery. Ct. 2 will be dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes. Court approves disposition, judgment entered to amended charge. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. No further court appearance required. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Brian F Guimar in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews Atty Duchac's motion to withdraw. Defendant wishes to talk to the DA and if that doesn't work out, to retain another attorney. State has no objection to motion. Court grants Atty Duchac's motion to withdraw. Court removes 1/05/16 jury from the calendar.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
by Atty Duchac. Court will address at 12/21/15 pretrial.

Attorney Clarence F. Duchac in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, indicates matter is now in the #1 position for trial. Atty Duchac requests adjournment of trial because of a conflict. State has no objection. Court removes 10/21/15 trial from the calendar, reschedule pretrial and trial. (JA to contact Atty Duchac when rescheduling)

Pre-trial conference at 10-05-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 10-21-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian F Guimar in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Duchac indicates matter is not resolved, asks court to set matter for trial. State withdraws their offer. Court will set pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.
No contact modification request from victim done through HELP.
Court converts no contact with M.N. to no violent contact with M.N.  Defendant is not to discuss the case with M.N.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Court addresses victims No Contact Modifcation Request. State objects to bond modification, makes statement. Defense gives argument, asks court to convert bond to no violent contact with victim. Court amends bond to no violent contact with victim. Not to discuss case with victim. All other conditions remain the same.

Defendant Brian F Guimar in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with M.N.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Brian F Guimar in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant requests time to retain an atty. Court adjourns matter. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/20/15 by jail staff.
